intro: Jacobaea cilicia, commonly known as the Cilician ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It produces yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. Jacobaea cilicia is also known for its toxic properties, containing pyrrolizidine alkaloids that can be harmful to livestock.
